page.text: You have defeated the robot. Now disabled, it slumps into a heap of tangled robotic limbs and actuators.

choice.text: Try to remove its computational components.
Try to remove something from its weapon system.

page.text: You attempt to extract the computational parts of the robot intact but your lack of skill just leads to you breaking them in an inept attempt to rip them out. They're useless now, but at least you have a few wires and chunks of the robot's casing as souvenirs. Or maybe they can be paperweights, or raw material for future use.

choice.text: Ah well, better luck next time.

page.text: You attempt to extract the delicate computation valves. The devices take a careful touch to extract from the surrounding systems but your steady your hands and manage to successfully extract two computation valves from the robot's brain, so to speak. To celebrate, you dismantle some of its wiring and casing for some additional raw materials.

You think you should try and extract the robot's weapon system, 'cause everything is better with lasers. Alas you're not as capable of that as you think you are and the robot's combination sensor and laser focusing optics is reduced to uselessness by your fumbling.

Looking at the robot's head, it's probably not possible to extract the laser system whole-cloth in any fashion that would be convenient or even possible to weild, but some elements may still be valuable. You set about dismounting the optical lenses and mirrors from inside the robot's otherwise empty head and soon enough, you have some relatively intact optical components for future use.

choice.text: Well, at least these might come in handy.
